definition: a barrier (usually thrown up hastily) to impede the advance of an enemy, to block off with barricades
details:
noun
- a barrier (usually thrown up hastily) to impede the advance of an enemy
= example: a barrier (usually thrown up hastily) to impede the advance of an enemy
- a barrier set up by police to stop traffic on a street or road in order to catch a fugitive or inspect traffic etc.
= synonyms: roadblock
verb
- to block off with barricades
= example: to block off with barricades
- to prevent access to by barricading
= example: to prevent access to by barricading
- to render unsuitable for passage
= example: to render unsuitable for passage
= synonyms: blockade
